SEARCH
Package com.karandev.util.net

Class TCPClient

java.lang.Object
com.karandev.util.net.TCPClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class TCPClient extends Object implements Closeable
Immutable TCP class for TCP socket operations.

Copyleft (c) 1993 by C and System Programmers Association (CSD) All Rights Free

Author:
JavaApp2-Jan-2024 Group

  • Constructor Details

    • TCPClient

      public TCPClient(String host, int port)

      Creates a new TCP client and connects to the specified host on port.

      Parameters:
      host - the hostname of the server
      port - the port number of the server
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if a connection cannot be established

    • TCPClient

      public TCPClient(InetAddress inetAddress, int port)

      Creates a new TCP client and connects to the specified inetAddress on port.

      Parameters:
      inetAddress - the InetAddress of the server
      port - the port number of the server
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if a connection cannot be established

  • Method Details

    • isOpen

      public boolean isOpen()

      Checks whether the TCP connection is open.

      Returns:
      true if the socket is open, false otherwise

    • getSocket

      public Socket getSocket()

      Returns the underlying Socket instance.

      Returns:
      the underlying Socket

    • receive

      public int receive(byte[] data, int offset, int length)

      Receives data with specified length from the server and stores it into the specified byte array.

      offset parameter can be used for offsetting the start index of the byte array.
      Parameters:
      data - the byte array to store the received data
      offset - the start offset in the array at which the data is written
      length - number of bytes to read
      Returns:
      the number of bytes read, or -1 if the end of the stream is reached before any data is read, or 0 when no bytes are read
      Throws:
      NetworkException - – if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receive(Socket, byte[], int, int)

    • receive

      public int receive(byte[] data)

      Receives data with specified length from the server and stores it into the specified byte array. This method uses default index offset as 0 and default length to receive is as big as incoming data.

      Parameters:
      data - the byte array to store the received data
      Returns:
      the number of bytes read
      Throws:
      NetworkException - – if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receive(Socket, byte[])

    • send

      public int send(byte[] data, int offset, int length)

      Sends data with specified length to the server. offset parameter can be used for offsetting the start index of the byte array.

      Parameters:
      data - the byte array containing the data to send
      offset - the start offset in the array from which the data is sent
      length - the number of bytes to send
      Returns:
      the number of bytes sent
      Throws:
      NetworkException - - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.send(Socket, byte[], int, int)

    • send

      public int send(byte[] data)

      Sends data with specified length to the server. This method uses default index offset as 0 and default length to send is as big as incoming data.

      Parameters:
      data - the byte array containing the data to send
      Returns:
      the number of bytes sent
      Throws:
      NetworkException - - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.send(Socket, byte[])

    • receiveStringViaLength

      public String receiveStringViaLength()

      Receives a length-prefixed string from the server using default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8

      Sender must use matching sendStringViaLength(String) method for successful transfer.

      Returns:
      the received string
      Throws:
      NetworkException - - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receiveStringViaLength(Socket)

    • receiveStringViaLength

      public String receiveStringViaLength(Charset charset)

      Receives a length-prefixed string from the server using specified charset.

      Sender must use matching sendStringViaLength(String, Charset) method for successful transfer.

      Parameters:
      charset - the charset to use for decoding the string
      Returns:
      the received string
      Throws:
      NetworkException - - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receiveStringViaLength(Socket, Charset)

    • receiveString

      public String receiveString(int length)

      Receives a string of a specified length using default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8 from the server.

      Parameters:
      length - the number of bytes to read as a string
      Returns:
      the received string
      Throws:
      NetworkException - - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receiveString(Socket, int)

    • receiveString

      public String receiveString(int length, Charset charset)

      Receives a string of a specified length, using a specified charset from the server.

      Parameters:
      length - the number of bytes to read as a string
      charset - the charset to use for decoding the string
      Returns:
      the received string
      Throws:
      NetworkException - - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receiveString(Socket, int, Charset)

    • receiveLine

      public String receiveLine(int blockSize)

      Receives a `\n\r` terminated string from the server using specified blockSize

      Parameters:
      blockSize - the block size to use for reading the line
      Returns:
      the received line of text
      Throws:
      NetworkException - - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receiveLine(Socket, int)

    • receiveLine

      Throws:

      See Also:
